pull.title: netbase: Do not print an error on connection timeouts through proxy
pull.body:
If a timeout happens while reading the proxy response, this effectively means we timed out while connecting to the remote node. This is very common for Tor, so do not print an error message to the log in that case.

Avoids a flood of 
```
2017-02-09 07:10:02 ERROR: Error reading proxy response
```
while running through Tor, causing users to blame the proxy.

Ref: #9430.

repo.name: bitcoin

events.message: netbase: Make InterruptibleRecv return an error code instead of bool

netbase: Do not print an error on connection timeouts through proxy

If a timeout happens while reading the proxy response, this effectively
means we timed out while connecting to the remote node. This is very
common for Tor, so do not print an error message.

issue.title: 'ERROR: Error reading proxy response' when using TOR on bitcoind
issue.body:
### Describe the issue
The problem is, the error message: 'ERROR: Error reading proxy response' in the debug.log file.
I wanted to simply run bitcoin over TOR. So in the bitcoin.conf file i had the following lines:
bind=127.0.0.1
port=8333
upnp=0
proxy=127.0.0.1:9050

Then i started bitcoind in terminal, i monitored the debug.log file and i saw that error message described above every minute or so while i was getting a new 'update tip' block.

To test if TOR was really working, i stopped the TOR service and i immediately got countless errors:
connect() to 127.0.0.1:9050 failed after select(): Connection refused (111)
connect() to 127.0.0.1:9050 failed after select(): Connection refused (111)
connect() to 127.0.0.1:9050 failed after select(): Connection refused (111)

So i realized that TOR was working, yet the original unknown error of:
'ERROR: Error reading proxy response'  occurred.

Please note: my intention was not to use a hidden tor service.
My intention was to simply torify outgoing connections as described in the first step here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/tor.md#1-run-bitcoin-behind-a-tor-proxy
and here:
https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=623868.0

### Expected behaviour
The expected behaviour should have been that bitcoin would run over tor without a proxy error while tor is actually working.

### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:bitcoin/bitcoin   (https://launchpad.net/~bitcoin/+archive/ubuntu/bitcoin)
sudo apt-get install bitcoind

### Machine specs:
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- Disk Type (HD/SDD): SSD

If there should be some other type of config that i am missing in bitcoin.conf please let me know.

issue.title: netbase: Do not print an error on connection timeouts through proxy
issue.body:
If a timeout happens while reading the proxy response, this effectively means we timed out while connecting to the remote node. This is very common for Tor, so do not print an error message to the log in that case.

Avoids a flood of
```
ERROR: Error reading proxy response
```

while running through Tor, causing users to blame the proxy.

Coming from upstream [9726](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9726)

issue.title: DNS Seeders unreachable when using proxy through Tor connections
issue.body:
### Can you reliably reproduce the issue?
#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
1. Enable proxy connections (either in GUI network tab) or adding `proxy=127.0.0.1:9050` in **dogecoin.conf**
2. Start dogecoin client

### Expected behaviour
Client establishes connections and acquires list of IPs from DNS seeders

### Actual behaviour
When client attempts to connect to the seeders it errors stating: `failed: host unreachable`

### Debug.log output:
```bash
2021-02-02 03:48:26 Loading addresses from DNS seeds (could take a while)
2021-02-02 03:48:26 0 addresses found from DNS seeds
2021-02-02 03:48:26 dnsseed thread exit
2021-02-02 03:48:36 ERROR: Error reading proxy response
2021-02-02 03:48:36 Socks5() connect to seed.multidoge.org:22556 failed: host unreachable
2021-02-02 03:48:57 ERROR: Error reading proxy response
2021-02-02 03:48:59 Socks5() connect to seed2.multidoge.org:22556 failed: host unreachable
2021-02-02 03:49:19 ERROR: Error reading proxy response

```

### What version of Dogecoin Core are you using?
Latest dogecoin-qt release version 1.14.2

### Machine specs:
- OS: ubuntu 18.04
- CPU: amd
- RAM: 8gb
- Disk size: 500gb
- Disk Type (HD/SDD): HD

### Addtional info:
Network connections that are established when running dogecoin client:
```bash
demon@Bionic18:~/Desktop/dogecoin-1.14.2/bin$ sudo netstat -antp|grep -E 'dog|\tor'
tcp        0      0 0.0.0.0:22555           0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      8567/./dogecoin-qt  
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:9050          0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN      1242/tor            
tcp        0      0 10.0.0.26:34998         178.170.42.112:9001     ESTABLISHED 1242/tor            
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:9050          127.0.0.1:51690         ESTABLISHED 1242/tor            
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:9050          127.0.0.1:51718         ESTABLISHED 1242/tor            
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:51718         127.0.0.1:9050          ESTABLISHED 8567/./dogecoin-qt  
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:51690         127.0.0.1:9050          ESTABLISHED 8567/./dogecoin-qt 
```

issue.title: [netbase] Do not print an error on connection timeouts through proxy
issue.body:
Avoids spamming the debug log with "error reading proxy response" due to a proxy/TOR connection timeout. See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9726

This also makes InterruptibleRecv return an error code instead of bool.

fixes #1693
